titleInfo.title: Photograph of picket signs protesting Metro Consolidation, ca. 1962

mods.identifier: Victor S. Johnson, Jr. Slide Collection - 34

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A photograph of picket signs protesting Metro Consolidation, circa 1962. There was a substantial protest movement against the consolidation of the city and county governments. Some opponents argued that creating a single government entity would be more costly in the long run and would not meet public service needs of the community. The anti-Metro signs pictured reflect a general paranoia of Communist plots to overtake local governments in the United States. b & w; 35 mm.

titleInfo.title: Victor S. Johnson, Jr. Slide Collection
